text: The men's pole vault event at the 2001 European Athletics U23 Championships was held in Amsterdam, Netherlands, at Olympisch Stadion on 13 and 15 July. ==Medalists== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; " width="35%" |- |bgcolor="gold"|Gold|| Lars Börgeling ' |- |bgcolor="silver"|Silver|| Mikko Latvala ' |- |bgcolor="CC9966"|Bronze|| Giuseppe Gibilisco ' |} ==Results== ===Final=== 15 July {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- !rowspan=2|Rank !!rowspan=2| Name !!rowspan=2| Nationality !!colspan=5|Attempts !!rowspan=2| Result !!rowspan=2| Notes |- ! 5.30 !! 5.40 !! 5.50 !! 5.60 !! 5.85 |- | || align=left | Lars Börgeling || align=left | || – || – || o || xo || xxx || 5.60 || |- | || align=left | Mikko Latvala || align=left | || o || – || xo || xxx || || 5.50 || |- | || align=left | Giuseppe Gibilisco || align=left | || xo || – || xo || xxx || || 5.50 || |- | 4 || align=left | Pierre-Charles Peuf || align=left | || o || xxo || xo || xxx || || 5.50 || |- | 5 || align=left | Javier Gazol || align=left | || o || xxx || || || || 5.30 || |- | 6 || align=left | Alhaji Jeng || align=left | || xo || – || xxx || || || 5.30 || |- | 7 || align=left | Adam Ptáček || align=left | || xxo || xxx || || || || 5.30 || |- | || align=left | Filippos Sgouros || align=left | || xxx || || || || || NM || |- | || align=left | Aleksey Khanafin || align=left | || xxx || || || || || NM || |- | || align=left | Spas Bukhalov || align=left | || xxx || || || || || NM || |- | || align=left | Gildas Verbist || align=left | || xxx || || || || || NM || |- | || align=left | Yevgeniy Mikhailichenko || align=left | || DNS || |} ===Qualifications=== 13 July Qualifying 5.50 or 12 best to the Final ====Group A==== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !!
